messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Yeah, this is an emergency. I'm a cab driver. This guy said his friend died on the road, but I don't see him. We're at Rosedale Park.
You're at Rosedale Park?
Yes. He's crying and saying his friend died here, but I don't see anything.
Your friend is what?
I don't see anything, but he's crying. He keeps saying his friend died here.
Is he hurt? Where exactly are you in Rosedale Park?
Rosedale Park, Kansas City, Kansas, at Mission Road.
Can I speak with your friend, please? Is he there?
Whoa, he's not my friend. I'm a cab driver. Come on, talk to me. Come on.
No, at Rosedale Park, he got electrocuted. He got electrocuted by a bad ground wire.
Sir, I understand Rosedale Park. Can you calm down and tell me what's happening?
At the tennis courts at Rosedale Park. My friend got electrocuted by a bad ground wire. Come here immediately.
I cannot get him off without being electrocuted myself. Come here right now.
Sir, I need you to calm down. I understand you're at Rosedale Park, Kansas City. What's going on there?
He's being electrocuted by a bad wire. He's stuck and being electrocuted to death.
Okay, someone's being electrocuted. Stay with him if you can do so safely. Can you describe exactly where you are in the park?
Mission Road, at the tennis courts.
Alright, I understand your location. Help is on the way. Are you safe?
I don't know. I'm here for him because he doesn't have a phone. I called.
Okay, stay with him if you can do so safely. Can you see any police or emergency vehicles?
I see one police car. It passed by.
Alright, help is on the way. Stay calm and try to keep him as calm as possible. They'll be there soon.
